business.headline: Trump's 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

Pharma stocks drag stock markets lower after Trump's 100% drug tariff threatAt 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 240.39 points at 80,919.29, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 86.30 points to 24,804.55. Broader market indices also mirrored the weakness.

Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

entertainment.headline: Case against Pawan Kalyan fans for creating ruckus at OG screening in Bengaluru Trouble has mounted for Pawan Kalyan fans after they created a ruckus at a Bengaluru theatre. The film released in theatres on September 25.

Homebound cleared with 11 cuts, cricket scene trimmed, certain dialogues muted Filmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' was cleared by the censor board with 11 cuts. The film's runtime was also shortened by 77 seconds.

OG box office Day 1: Pawan Kalyan's film explodes to massive Rs 100-crore haul Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' smashed Rs 100 crore on its opening day, including paid premieres. The gangster drama, directed by Sujeeth, has received glowing reviews from fans.

Farhan Akhtar moved by Dwayne Johnson's The Smashing Machine: Can't wait to see Dwayne Johnson impressed fans with his physical transformation in the upcoming biopic 'The Smashing Machine'. After getting international recognition, the film found a fan in Bolllywood actor Farhan Akhtar.

Janaawar review: Bhuvan Arora' show delivers hard-hitting take on caste, society 'Janaawar: The Beast Within' is a gripping crime drama set in a small town, with Bhuvan Arora shining as a cop balancing duty and family. The series explores caste, identity, and the darker sides of human nature. Read our review.

International Emmy Awards 2025 nominations full list: Chamkila, Ludwig get nods 2025 International Emmy nominations feature 64 contenders from 26 countries. United Kingdom leads with 12 nominations, followed by Brazil and South Africa. 'Ludwig' and 'Amar Singh Chamkila' received multiple nods.

Bhumi Pednekar on trolls: Resilience keeps me going in tough times Actor Bhumi Pednekar at India Today Mumbai Conclave on facing trolls, resilience, box-office lows, and finding courage beyond cinema.

Diljit Dosanjh, Amar Singh Chamkila nominated for International Emmys Diljit Dosanjh has earned an International Emmy nomination for Best Actor for his role in 'Amar Singh Chamkila', which is also competing for Best TV Movie, marking a global recognition of the legendary singer's story.

Video: Ektaa Kapoor talks Kyunki, motherhood and National Award win for Kathal Producer Ektaa Kapoor spoke about 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', motherhood and more during her appearance at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She was present at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Did Ektaa Kapoor take a dig at Ram Kapoor's weight loss? Producer breaks silence Ektaa Kapoor shuts down speculation linking her post to Ram Kapoor, calling it a wild misinterpretation.
"I was talking about body image, not taking a dig," she said while speaking on Day One of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Varun Dhawan on Sunny Sanskari vs Kantara clash: There's room for all films Varun Dhawan's upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' is a lighthearted entertainer designed to uplift moods rather than preach life lessons. The actor graced India Today Conclave 2025 on Thursday and called the film a mood-lifting entertainer.

Ektaa Kapoor on 30 years of content creation: It's not about success but relevance Ektaa Kapoor spoke on Day 1 of the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She shared insights on her three-decade-long journey, highlighting the importance of relevance over mere success.

Ektaa Kapoor never imagined Kathal would win best film at National Awards Producer Ektaa Kapoor shared her excitement about winning the National Award for her film 'Kathal' at the India Today Mumbai Conclave. She expressed that not in her wildest dreams did she think a dramedy would clinch the award.

We're children of cinema: Kamal Haasan to youngest National Award winner Treesha Kamal Haasan congratulated young Treesha Thosar, who became the youngest recipient to win a National Award at the age of four. The veteran actor won a National Award when he was six years old.

We are tackling various judgements women are put through: Ektaa Kapoor on Kyunki... Ektaa Kapoor spoke about her experience in the film and television industry at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She appeared at the session titled 'Queen of Content: Woman Who Shaped Indian Screens'.

Nagarjuna gets Delhi High Court protection from AI misuse, fake content Nagarjuna Akkineni has secured a significant victory from the Delhi High Court to protect his personality and publicity rights against unauthorised use of his name, image and voice, especially in AI-generated content. This landmark ruling highlights the growing concern over misuse of celebrity identities in India's digital age.

OTT this week: Fantastic Four, Son of Sardaar 2, Slow Horses and more to stream This week's OTT line-up offers a mix of thrillers, dramas, and superhero sagas, from Marvel's 'Fantastic Four' and 'Marvel Zombies' to the much-awaited 'Slow Horses Season 5' and 'Alice in Borderland 3'. With regional gems like 'Sundarakanda' and gritty dramas like 'Janaawar', there's something for every kind of viewer.

What is the scene in The Ba***ds of Bollywood that offended Sameer Wankhede? Former Narcotics Control Bureau official Sameer Wankhede has filed Rs 2 crore defamation suit against the producers of Aryan Khan's Netflix series The B***ds of Bollywood. He has alleged that a character on the show is a parody of him.

Emma Watson says Hollywood broke her, explains break from acting Hollywood actor Emma Watson shared her reasons for taking a step back from acting in a recent podcast. She opened up about the lack of connection after 'Harry Potter' and how competition, envy and hierarchy affected her experiences on set.

general news.headline: Hit by US tariffs, Modi asking Putin to explain Ukraine plan: Nato chief's big claimNATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte said US President Donald Trump's tariffs on India are indirectly impacting Russia.

Trump's 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.

Pakistan PM Sharif, Army chief Munir hold closed-door talks with TrumpPakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif met President Donald Trump at the White House in his first Oval Office visit, joined by Army Chief Asim Munir, as US-Pakistan relations show signs of revival.

Ex-CJI Chandrachud responds to charge of giving bail cases to Justice Bela TrivediRejecting the charge that bail matters were concentrated with one judge during his tenure as Chief Justice, DY Chandrachud said that cases involving bail are dealt with by every single bench of the Supreme Court.

Why Indian elections are mostly free but rarely fairWhile Indian elections have become freer, they are much less fairer. At the heart of electoral democracy is the belief in a 'Level Playing Field' (LPL): every candidate and party who contests should begin from the same starting point. Instead, now we have a totally skewed race where those in power have a massive advantage over their rivals.

MiG-21 to be retired after 62 years in service with grand farewell ceremony todayAt a grand farewell ceremony in Chandigarh, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, top military leaders, veterans, and families will gather to mark the end of the iconic fighter jet's 62 years of distinguished service.

Apple Watch Series 11 review: Come for sleep tracking, stay for long battery lifeThe new Apple Watch Series 11 looks and works almost similar to the Watch Series 10. But it does bring better battery life, which makes a real difference in use.

Suryakumar advised to avoid political comments at ICC hearing over PAK complain: SourcesThe ICC has advised India captain Suryakumar Yadav to avoid political statements after a PCB complaint over his tribute following the India-Pakistan group-stage clash. His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

Homebound cleared with 11 cuts, cricket scene trimmed, certain dialogues mutedFilmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' was cleared by the censor board with 11 cuts. The film's runtime was also shortened by 77 seconds.

Bengaluru shop owner, aide brutally thrash woman accused of saree theft, arrestedA Bengaluru shopkeeper and his aide were arrested for publicly assaulting a woman accused of stealing Rs 91,500 worth of sarees. Videos show her being dragged and kicked. Police also arrested the woman for theft.

'U' didn't get bail, DY Chandrachud was told. Are you aware of 'P', he retortedFormer Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud dismissed allegations that he deliberately assigned bail matters to Justice Bela Trivedi, perceived as less likely to grant relief. Speaking at the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, he called such claims "unsubstantiated" and contrary to court records, adding that Supreme Court cases are randomly allocated by a computer.

DY Chandrachud said that they had granted bail in over 21,000 cases and that when it was said a particular individual didn't get bail, in his court every individual who deserved bail had received it.

When he was questioned about U (Umar Khalid) not getting bail, he said, "If U didn't get bail, it was not my courtroom. Are you aware of a P (Pawan Khera)? Pawan Khera was sought to be arrested as he was boarding a flight...his lawyer comes to the Supreme Court at lunch time and says my client is being arrested because he said something distasteful...Who protected him? The Supreme Court protected him," he said at the India Today Conclave.

Amazon to pay $2.5 billion for tricking users into unwanted Prime sign-upsAmazon will pay $2.5 billion to settle claims over misleading Prime subscription tactics. The deal aims to improve cancellation processes but leaves Prime's dominance largely intact.

The Gucci glow-up: Alia Bhatt's boldest fashion era yetWith over a decade in the film industry, Alia's style has always been a source of inspiration - especially with her ethnic looks and effortlessly relatable choices. But ever since her Gucci contract, she's been pushing the envelope like never before, radiating a true global fashion appeal.

BJP finalises Bihar poll contenders, over 15 sitting MLAs may be droppedAfter a marathon two-day meeting, the BJP has compiled a list of ticket contenders for Bihar. Sources indicate tickets for around 15 to 18 sitting MLAs could be cancelled, signaling a major reshuffle.

TDP's Nandamuri Balakrishna calls Jagan Reddy 'psycho' in Andhra assembly, stirs rowAndhra Pradesh Assembly saw heated exchanges after TDP MLA Nandamuri Balakrishna called ex-Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy a "psycho" during a law-and-order debate. Chiranjeevi clarified his role in the film industry delegation meeting Jagan Reddy.

Trump signs order bringing TikTok under US ownership, says China on boardUS President Donald Trump signed an executive order approving a US-led takeover of TikTok's American business, with Oracle and other investors set to control a majority stake.

Diljit Dosanjh, Amar Singh Chamkila nominated for International EmmysDiljit Dosanjh has earned an International Emmy nomination for Best Actor for his role in 'Amar Singh Chamkila', which is also competing for Best TV Movie, marking a global recognition of the legendary singer's story.

What the rupee slide to a new low against a weak dollar meansThe rupee has been pressured by the punishing US tariffs, H-1B visa fee hike and sustained outflows of foreign portfolio investors from India

Global workforce a reality: S Jaishankar's message amid H-1B fee chaosSpeaking at an ORF event during the UN General Assembly, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted the global need for a distributed workforce, noting that many countries cannot meet labour demands from their own populations.

Grandmother, 73, deported to India after 30 years in US, didn't get to say goodbyeA 73-year-old Sikh woman who lived in the US for over 30 years was deported to India by the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Harjit Kaur, originally from Punjab, was not even allowed to say goodbye to her family before being deported to India. She was handcuffed as she was taken to the ICE centre in Los Angeles.

Video: About 25 suspects ransack California jewellery store in USD 1 million heistPolice said the mob smashed display cases, fired shots at the entrance, and briefly became trapped inside before forcing their way out.

Case against Pawan Kalyan fans for creating ruckus at OG screening in BengaluruTrouble has mounted for Pawan Kalyan fans after they created a ruckus at a Bengaluru theatre. The film released in theatres on September 25.

What Ex-CJI Chandrachud said on nepo-kid allegationsFormer Chief Justice of India (CJI) DY Chandrachud said there needs to be standard system to recruit judges. On the charges of being a product of nepotism, he said that people need to be judged by the quality of their work. Chandrachud's father was also a CJI.

You can refuse a 9 pm work call...if your boss is Krittika MarwahaKrittika Marwaha, the founder of a Gurugram-based company, addressed how the relentless drive to build a company often pushes leaders to expect the same level of sacrifice from their teams.

sports.headline: Suryakumar advised to avoid political comments at ICC hearing over PAK complain: Sources The ICC has advised India captain Suryakumar Yadav to avoid political statements after a PCB complaint over his tribute following the India-Pakistan group-stage clash. His dedication to Operation Sindoor and Pahalgam attack victims sparked controversy ahead of the Asia Cup final.

IND v SL preview: India face dead rubber dilemma ahead of Pakistan final Asia Cup, IND vs SL Super 4 preview: With the final against Pakistan looming, India find themselves caught in the classic dead rubber dilemma — to experiment or to consolidate. Friday's clash with Sri Lanka may not alter the standings, but it offers India a chance to settle questions over form, sharpen their fielding, and build the rhythm they need for the big showdown.

Smriti Mandhana eyes more records after stellar Australia series: Stats Preview Smriti Mandhana has delivered a stunning ODI series against Australia, breaking records with her explosive batting. She now aims for historic milestones at the upcoming Women's World Cup, raising expectations and excitement.

The Wall gets tougher: Sreejesh trades easygoing charm for coaching discipline From being a chill goalkeeper on the field to being a strict taskmaster on the halfway line, PR Sreejesh tells India Today about his coaching style, mentor role with SG Pipers and his ultimate goal as the senior team coach.

Watch: Fans troll Pakistan for fielding blunder vs Bangladesh ahead of India final Pakistan survived a shaky fielding performance to beat Bangladesh by 11 runs in the Asia Cup Super 4, but a missed run-out sparked social media trolling ahead of their high-stakes final against India.

IND vs PAK final: Pakistan coach urges players to focus on cricket amid off-field row Ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 final, Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson urges players to concentrate on cricket and avoid distractions from recent controversies. India and Pakistan will clash for the third time in this tournament.

Abhishek Sharma powerplay successor to Rohit Sharma: Mohammad Kaif on India opener Mohammed Kaif believes that Abhishek Sharma has stepped into Rohit Sharma's shoes as India's powerplay enforcer. With fearless batting and consistent runs in the Asia Cup 2025, the youngster is shaping into a match-winner at the very top.

Mike Hesson's blueprint: How Pakistan plan to challenge India in Asia Cup final Asia Cup 2025: Head coach Mike Hesson said Pakistan are capable of toppling India in Sunday's final. However, the New Zealand tactician cautioned his players that there are no shortcuts against the world's No. 1 side, stressing that being "good enough for long enough" is the only path to success.

England rout India by 153 runs in Women's World Cup warm-up fixture in Bengaluru Nat Sciver-Brunt scored a sparkling century as England defeated India by 153 runs in their warm-up match. India suffered a setback with Arundhati Reddy's injury ahead of the World Cup.

Salman Agha confident of avenging previous defeats vs India in Asia Cup final Pakistan captain Salman Agha expresses confidence in his men to beat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final. India have beaten Pakistan in both matches of the Asia Cup 2025 so far.

41 years, 17 Asia Cups later, it's an India vs Pakistan final India and Pakistan will meet in the Asia Cup 2025 final for the first time ever. Pakistan qualified for the final with an 11-run victory over Bangladesh in their last Super 4 clash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
